title: BBC breached editorial guidelines over Gaza documentary narrated by son of Hamas official
description: Gaza: How To Survive A Warzone featured narration from the son of Hamas's deputy minister of agriculture.
content:
The BBC has said it breached its editorial guidelines by failing to disclose that the child narrator of a Gaza documentary was the son of a Hamas official.
A report into the controversial programme said three members of the independent production com... [3491 chars]

title: Brooklyn and beyond: Colm Tóibín’s best books - ranked!
description: As the Irish author turns 70, we rate his best works of fiction – from his latest, Long Island, to his emotionally wrenching ‘masterpiece’
content:
10 Nora Webster (2014)
This dispatch from what we might call the extended Colm Tóibín universe is set near the same time and in the same place as his earlier novel Brooklyn (one character appears in both books). It’s the story of a widowed woman who ... [7381 chars]

title: Post Office could hand ownership to staff amid review after Horizon scandal
description: Ministers to consider mutualisation as an option in first big review of the organisation in 15 years
content:
Ministers are to consider handing over ownership of the Post Office to its operators after the Horizon IT scandal.
The Department for Business and Trade (DBT) has published a green paper, starting the first big review of the scandal-plagued organisat... [4069 chars]

title: 'PSG lost their heads' - reaction as Chelsea win Club World Cup
description: Reaction to the Club World Cup final as Chelsea beat Paris Saint-Germain 3-0 in New Jersey to win the newly-expanded competition.
content:
'We showed that we deserved to win this trophy' - Gusto

title: Thames Water to introduce hosepipe ban across four counties
description: The Temporary Use Ban, in areas with a postcode starting with OX, GL, SN and RG4, RG8 and RG9, will come into operation at one minute past midnight on Tuesday 22 July.
content:
Thames Water is introducing a hosepipe ban across Swindon, Gloucestershire, Oxfordshire, Berkshire and Wiltshire.
It comes after the Environment Agency placed the Thames area into its Prolonged Dry Weather category, meaning there is a heightened risk... [2594 chars]
